title: Is there any proofreading service available online? - Quora

response.answer_text: Thanks for your request Sanaz. If you mean a computerised AI-based system, then the most popular proofreading service is Grammarly. This is like an advanced version of Word’s spellchecker and enables you to check your own work for free (there is also a paid version) in terms of grammar, spelling, punctuation, word choice, sentence structure, and so on. However, it’s worth noting that you’d still have to do the work yourself using their suggestions, and it’s not always accurate since it’s based on AI rather than a true human understanding of language. The other option is to hire a proofreader, and in my opinion this is a better option because you’ll get a more accurate result than using a computerised system. What’s more, when you find a good proofreader, you can develop an ongoing relationship with them and rest assured that your documents are in good hands. There are various proofreading services available online (either personal websites of individual freelancers or companies who provide proofreading services via a range of proofreaders). If you Google “proofreading services”, you can find plenty of these, so you’d just need to compare the offerings from the various websites to find the best one for you. Alternatively, one of the fastest ways to find proofreaders online is using freelancing platforms such as PeoplePerHour, Upwork, and Freelancer. There are hundreds of freelance proofreaders on these sites, and you can quickly compare their feedback, prices, and level of experience. Plus these sites provide messaging, file sharing, a review system, and payment protection, so you get security in the working relationship. Best of luck finding the right proofreading service for you!

Well, I have several options for you: You can find a freelancer who will do proofreading of your texts. I can recommend you these websites: Guru, Upwork, PeoplePerHour.Use grammar checkers. For example, Scribens, Grammarly, Ginger Grammar Checker. If you want to learn more, here you’ll find more information: Top Free Grammar Checkers.You can proofread your texts by yourself using the following tips:Make sure the text is coherent. Proofreading is not just grammar correction, your job is to make sure the text is logically correct and structured.Use a readability score service. You are probably aware of what a readability score is. For those of you who are not - this is a special scale with many parameters that can analyze any text and assign a score to it.Create a checklist. You can use some points from this article as high level items, and then expand them by adding more specific items, the things you need to pay attention to.Read words, not sentences. This is a tough call, especially, when the text is yours. Our brain doesn’t need to interpret every symbol and every word for a text to make sense to us, so you can accidentally skip mistakes if you don’t concentrate on separate words properly. ~Source: ‘Proofreading Tips for Technical Writers’.
